intro: Synaphe, commonly known as the common synaphe, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is often found in temperate regions. Synaphe is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine. Its reproductive structures are adapted for wind pollination, which is typical for many members of its family.
